p: Plants of B. orientalis, growing in a dense patch in Lublin (51°08′–51° 18′ N, 22°27′–22° 41′ E), SE Poland, were studied in the field and sampled during 2007, 2009 and 2012. The experimental patch (10 m × 20 m) was covered by the stable phytocoenoses the Bunietum orientalis developed on a sandy-dusty, grey-brown soil (pH in 1 n KCl = 7.4).
